title: Karnataka introduces welfare bill for cine workers, cess of up to 2% on movie tickets for welfare fund
selftext: The Karnataka Labour Department introduced a bill in the state legislature to set up a welfare board for film artists and cultural activists.
comments:
> The Karnataka Labour Department introduced a bill in the state legislature to set up a welfare board for film artists and cultural activists.

> One of the two main provisions in the Bill is to constitute a Karnataka Cine and Cultural Activists’ Welfare Board for registration of cinema workers, to create welfare schemes, and to address grievances.

> The second key provision is to establish a fund called “The Karnataka Cine and Cultural Activists Social Security and Welfare Fund” through the collection of a cess, contributions from film personalities, and grants from the state.

As much as I hate freebies I don't hate this tbh. The artists are very much underpaid and undervalued and this is a welcoming step by the Karnataka government. This kind of empowering welfarism I can get behind. I also won't have a problem with paying extra cess knowing that it's going towards the welfare of artists.
